title: Bug 102436 - Date/time value not stored correctly in report design
description: An invalid date/time string (which does not conform to a universal format or the system default locale format) should have been rejected.
OB:
When creating a new 'DateTime' type report parameter in the BIRT report designer, if an invalid date string like '55/66/9999' is entered in the 'defaultValue' field, the invalid value is accepted. This is evident from the following definition in the report design:
<parameters>
<scalarparameter name="dateParam1">
<property name="dataType">dateTime</property>
<property name="allowBlank">false</property>
<property name="format">Unformatted</property>
<property name="controlType">textbox</property>
<expression name="defaultValue">55/66/9999</expression>
</scalarparameter>
</parameters>
EB:
Two problems are observed here:

1. The model should have stored a dateTime type constant using the XML schema date/time format (yyyymmddThh:mm:ss, see [http://www.w3.org/TR/xmlschema2/]), which is locale independent, to ensure portability.

2. The date value should have been validated by the UI or model.
SR:
To reproduce:
1. Open the BIRT report designer.
2. Create a new report parameter of type 'DateTime'.
3. In the 'defaultValue' field, enter an invalid date string, such as '55/66/9999'.
4. Observe that the invalid value is accepted and is displayed in the report design.

Expected result:
The invalid date value should be rejected and an error should be displayed indicating the validation failure.
